intro: Corunastylis filiformis, commonly known as the slender corunastylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
